text: Hi all, I ma trying to turn a CPU run into a GPU run so I can do some high resolution tests and maybe, down the line, play with the Stokes drift fields. What version of CUDA is required?

elements.text: Hi all, I ma trying to turn a CPU run into a GPU run so I can do some high resolution tests and maybe, down the line, play with the Stokes drift fields. What version of CUDA is required?

text: CUDA.jl will download any necessary CUDA drivers so you generally don't have to worry about the CUDA library version

elements.text: CUDA.jl will download any necessary CUDA drivers so you generally don't have to worry about the CUDA library version

text: If you have an old GPU it might be too old to support everything in CUDA.jl but a warning will be printed in this case

elements.text: If you have an old GPU it might be too old to support everything in CUDA.jl but a warning will be printed in this case

text: Ah ok yeah that's quite common I think.

elements.text: Ah ok yeah that's quite common I think.

text: In this case you probably want to build on one of the compute/work nodes with a GPU.

elements.text: In this case you probably want to build on one of the compute/work nodes with a GPU.

text: Otherwise when building CUDA.jl, it won't see a GPU and might only build some barebones CPU functionality (e.g. the `CUDA.has_cuda()` function).

text: A Project.toml will record which packages your environment depends on, while the Manifest.toml file records exactly which versions of each package your environment relies on.

elements.text: A Project.toml will record which packages your environment depends on, while the Manifest.toml file records exactly which versions of each package your environment relies on.

text:
The `DEPOT_PATH` variable should store the current depot path if you want to double check that it's pointing to the right place, e.g.
```julia> DEPOT_PATH
3-element Vector{String}:
 "/home/alir/.julia"
 "/home/alir/bin/julia-1.6.0-rc1/local/share/julia"
 "/home/alir/bin/julia-1.6.0-rc1/share/julia"```

elements.text: Hmmm, NCDatasets.jl and NetCDF_jll could fail to build on PowerPC architectures...

text: What's the output of `versioninfo()`?

The Rutgers julia user helped out a bunch. I think the issues were (1) that I may have been automatically placed on an older gpu node that may not have been capable of doing what I needed and (2) I wasn’t requesting enough memory and that was causing the seg fault during the download.
I think my next steps are to make a gpu specific environment (or project? Whatever they are in julia) to keep a working build in. Then I get to start doing the part that I thought would be harder than this, the coding of my forcing functions in GPU friendly ways.

elements.text:
The Rutgers julia user helped out a bunch. I think the issues were (1) that I may have been automatically placed on an older gpu node that may not have been capable of doing what I needed and (2) I wasn’t requesting enough memory and that was causing the seg fault during the download.
I think my next steps are to make a gpu specific environment (or project? Whatever they are in julia) to keep a working build in. Then I get to start doing the part that I thought would be harder than this, the coding of my forcing functions in GPU friendly ways.
